forecast.detailedForecast: Rain likely. Mostly cloudy. High near 58, with temperatures falling to around 56 in the afternoon. South southeast wind 6 to 17 mph, with gusts as high as 33 mph. Chance of precipitation is 70%. New rainfall amounts between a tenth and quarter of an inch possible.

weather_report:
In the early hours of this Thursday, Downtown San Francisco stands shrouded in a heavy, pervasive gloom. The forecast calls for a steady drizzle throughout the night, with rain expected to continue into the day, adding a distinct chill to the air. Temperature dips, meeting just around 51 degrees, resulting in a rather dreary atmosphere where the low clouds obscure even the most familiar outlines of the Golden Gate. The wind from the southeast, brisk at times, carries with it the damp scent of the earth awakening, a reminder of winter’s embrace. 

As the day unfolds, expect the rain to persist, accompanied by a shift in temperatures that will hover near 58, before taking a slight dive in the afternoon. The air will carry a thicker weight, typical of San Francisco’s wintertime, marked by gusts reaching up to 33 mph that may whip through your coat as you navigate the streets. The fog remains a stubborn companion, particularly in the early moments, blurring visibility and casting the city in soft greys. In light of these conditions, dress warmly, opting for layers that can adapt to shifting temperatures—a waterproof outer layer will serve you well against the expected precipitation. With such a damp backdrop, a good book or a cozy café may provide the best refuge, inviting you to savor a warm drink while watching the world outside transform into a watercolor of muted colors.
